definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: With Basecamp, just sign up and use it right away.
sentences.chinese: 随著大本营，只要注册并使用它的权利了。

sentences.english: With the building of the South Manchurian Railway, Mukden became a Russian stronghold.
sentences.chinese: 随着铁路建设的南满，奉天成为俄罗斯的大本营。

sentences.english: His great abilities might have prevented many a blunder at the Fuehrer's headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 他的非凡才能可能使元首大本营避免铸成许多大错。

sentences.english: " Look at the quiet reserved Zhou Bichang Break how "happy camp "?
sentences.chinese: 看文静内敛的周笔畅如何玩转《快乐大本营》？

sentences.english: The club is the last stonghold of male privilege.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部是最后一个保持男人特权的大本营。

sentences.english: For a while, field command on the three cars out of the camp.
sentences.chinese: 一会，上田指挥着三辆车驶出大本营。

sentences.english: All climbers are now safely back at base camp.
sentences.chinese: 所有登山队员现在都安全回到了大本营。

sentences.english: One of the Fuehrer's cars drove me to headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 车队的一辆轿车，把我接到大本营。

sentences.english: In this the King of France established his own headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 法王路易则在这里设下他自己的大本营。

sentences.english: It does not pin-point my home base as close as other GPS do.
sentences.chinese: 它不针点，我像其他的GPS做密切的大本营。

sentences.english: The team returns to the warehouse and Sara treats Sucre.
sentences.chinese: 团队回到了大本营，莎拉对苏克雷进行了治疗处理。

sentences.english: They radioed their position to headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 他们用无线电向大本营报告他们所处的位置。

sentences.english: Braunau was the chief headquarters of the commander-in-chief, Kutuzov.
sentences.chinese: 库图佐夫总司令的大本营也坐落在布劳瑙。

sentences.english: RED is attacking from the BLU base in the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 红队一开始是从蓝队的大本营开始进攻。

sentences.english: He gathered women and children as human shields at his compound.
sentences.chinese: 他将妇女与儿童聚集起来作为其大本营的人体盾牌。

sentences.english: Basecamp will help you to manage multiple projects with customers or team members.
sentences.chinese: 大本营将帮助您管理多个项目，与客户或团队成员。

definition: stronghold/defended military base/base for operations/strategic point/foothold/(market) presence
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to assemble/to concentrate/to mass/to build up/to marshal
to drop from the sky/(fig.) to appear out of nowhere/(attributive) airborne
expeditionary force/army on a distant expedition
domain/territory under one's control/foundation of a building/base of operations/crust of earth
